g

ga 1.1

adj. who goes; goes after; going; gone; having gone; being [√gam + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from gacchati
Meaning who goes; goes after; going; gone; having gone; being
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ga
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

obhāsajātaṃ phalagaṃ,
cittaṃ yassa abhiṇhaso,
t'ādisaṃ bhikkhum'āsajja,
kaṇha dukkhaṃ nigacchasī'ti.

TH 25 nandiyattheragāthā

evaṃ mano chassu yadā subhāvito,
phuṭṭhassa cittaṃ na vikampate kvaci,
te rāgadose abhibhuyya bhikkhavo,
bhavattha jātimaraṇassa pāragā'ti.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
ga 2.1

ind. 3rd item in a numerical list; lit. letter g ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning 3rd item in a numerical list; lit. letter g
Sanskrit ga

(ga) katamo eko dhammo pariññeyyo? phasso s'āsavo upādāniyo. ayaṃ eko dhammo pariññeyyo.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ
gagana

nt. sky ✗
gagga

masc. name of the family of Aṅgulimāla ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of the family of Aṅgulimāla
gaggarā

fem. name of a lotus pond near Campā; lit. gurgling [gaggara + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, onom, from gaggara
Meaning name of a lotus pond near Campā; lit. gurgling
Construction gaggara + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Commentary (MNa) gaggarā'ti laddhavohārā pokkharaṇī atthi. tassā tīre samantato nīl'ādipañcavaṇṇakusumapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ mahantaṃ campakavanaṃ. tasmiṃ bhagavā kusumagandhasugandhe campakavane viharati. taṃ sandhāya gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit gargara, gargā (bsk)

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā campāyaṃ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.

DN 34.1 dasuttarasuttaṃ
gaggarāyati

pr. bellows, roars ✗
gaggarāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 8.11 (SN8.11) ✗
gagghati

fut. (+acc) will go; will walk; will wander around [√gam + a + issa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of gacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning will go; will walk; will wander around
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a + issa > gaggha (fut, irreg)
Construction gaggha + ti
Commentary (ANa) gagghasī'ti gamissasi.
Sanskrit gamiṣyati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

yena yen'eva gagghasi phāsuṃ'y'eva gagghasi, yattha yattha ṭhassasi phāsuṃ'y'eva ṭhassasi, yattha yattha nisīdissasi phāsuṃ'y'eva nisīdissasi, yattha yattha seyyaṃ kappessasi phāsuṃ'y'eva seyyaṃ kappessasī'ti.

AN 8.63 saṃkhittasuttaṃ
gaṅgā 1

fem. name of a river; one of the five great rivers of ancient India ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a river; one of the five great rivers of ancient India
Sanskrit gaṅgā

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yā kāci mahānadiyo, seyyath'idaṃ gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī, tā mahāsamuddaṃ patvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni, mahāsamuddo'tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇaphalakaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu sā gaṅgā nadī amunā loṇaphalena loṇaṃ assa apeyyā'ti?

Grammar adj, comp

Sanskrit gaṅgā + sama

gaccha 1

imp. (+acc) go!; begone! [√gam + a + a] ✓

Grammar imp 2nd sg of gacchatu, trans (+acc)
Meaning go!; begone!
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + a
Sanskrit gaccha
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

taggha'si, tāta kumma, khato, taggha upahato. etena hi te, tāta kumma, suttakena pitaro ca pitāmahā ca anayaṃ āpannā byasanaṃ āpannā. gaccha dāni tvaṃ, tāta kumma, na dāni tvaṃ amhākan'ti.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ

hivibhatti lopam'āpajjate vā. gaccha, gacchāhi, gama, gamāhi, gamaya, gamayāhi. hī'ti kim'atthaṃ? gacchati, gamayati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 479

gacchati 1

pr. (+acc) goes; walks; moves; wanders around [√gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning goes; walks; moves; wanders around
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + ti
Sanskrit gacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gacchanto vā gacchāmī'ti pajānāti ṭhito vā ṭhito'mhī'ti pajānāti nisinno vā nisinno'mhī'ti pajānāti sayāno vā sayāno'mhī'ti pajānāti

DN 22.3 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

yassa loke sakaṃ n'atthi,
asatā ca na socati,
dhammesu ca na gacchati,
sa ve santo'ti vuccatī'ti.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
gacchanta

prp. (+acc) going; walking; travelling [√gam + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of gacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning going; walking; travelling
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit gacchat, gamat
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

addasāma kho mayaṃ, bho, taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ gacchantaṃ, addasāma ṭhitaṃ, addasāma antaragharaṃ pavisantaṃ, addasāma antaraghare nisinnaṃ tuṇhībhūtaṃ

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

gacchanto kho pana ujumaggen'eva gacchati, tatr'āyaṃ ujumaggo, seyyath'idaṃ, sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākamm'anto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
gacchamāna

prp. (+acc) going; walking [√gam + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of gacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning going; walking
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Sanskrit gacchamāna
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

ye'me pañca kāmaguṇā cetaso samphuṭṭhapubbā atītā niruddhā vipariṇatā, tatra me cittaṃ bahulaṃ gacchamānaṃ gaccheyya paccuppannesu vā appaṃ vā anāgatesu.

SN 35.117 kāmaguṇasuttaṃ

gamu'icc'etassa dhātussa anto makāro ccho hoti vā sabbāsu paccayavibhattīsu. gacchamāno, gacchanto. gacchati, gameti. gacchatu, gametu. gaccheyya. gameyya. agacchā, agamā. agacchī, agamī. gacchissati, gamissati. agacchissā, agamissā. gamisse'ti kim'atthaṃ? icchati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 476
gacchaṃ

aor. (+acc) I myself went [√gam + a + aṃ] ✓

Grammar aor, reflx 1st sg of gacchi, trans (+acc)
Meaning I myself went
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + aṃ
Variant agamaṃ
Notes also see gacchanta
Sanskrit agacche
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

eso hi bhagavā buddho,
nadiṃ nerañjaraṃ pati,
sabbadukkhappahānāya,
dhammaṃ deseti pāṇinaṃ,
tass'āhaṃ santikaṃ gacchaṃ,
so me satthā bhavissati.

THI 68 ekudāniyattheragāthā
gacchāvuso

sandhi. begone friend!; go away brother! [gaccha + āvuso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, imp + masc
Meaning begone friend!; go away brother!
Construction gaccha + āvuso
Sanskrit gaccha + āyusmanto

gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 42 uyyojanasikkhāpadaṃ
gacchi

aor. went, moved, walked [√gam] ✗
gaccheyya

opt. (+acc) could go; would move; would walk [√gam + a + eyya] ✓

Grammar opt of gacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning could go; would move; would walk
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction gaccha + eyya
Commentary (MNa) yaṃnūn'āhaṃ saṇikaṃ gaccheyyan'ti kiṃ me iminā sīghagamanena, saṇikaṃ gacchissāmī'ti cintesi.
Sanskrit gacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

pathaviyā'pi ummujjanimujjaṃ kareyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi udake, udake'pi abhijjamāno gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pathaviyaṃ, ākāse'pi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pakkhī sakuṇo

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso sīghaṃ gaccheyya. tassa evam'assa, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ sīghaṃ gacchāmi? yaṃnūn'āhaṃ saṇikaṃ gaccheyyan'ti. so saṇikaṃ gaccheyya.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ
gaja

masc. elephant [√gaj + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning elephant
Root Family √gaj
Root √gaj×1 a (roar, make sound)
Construction √gaj + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym hatthi, hatthī, kuñjara, mātaṅga
Sanskrit gaja
Sanskrit Root √gaj 1 (roar)

tathā tu kassāmi yathā'pi issaro,
yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
vīriyena taṃ mayha vas'ānayissaṃ,
gajaṃ'va mattaṃ kusal'aṅkusaggaho.

bahubheravaṃ ratanagaṇānam'ālayaṃ,
najjo yathā naragaṇasaṅghasevitā,
puthū savantī upayanti sāgaraṃ.

atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bodhisatto aparena samayena eko gaṇamhā vūpakaṭṭho vihāsi, aññen'eva tāni caturāsīti pabbajitasahassāni agamaṃsu, aññena maggena vipassī bodhisatto.

gaṇakī

fem. courtesan; high class prostitute; (comm) wife of an accountant [√gaṇ + a + kī] ~

Grammar fem, from gaṇa
Meaning courtesan; high class prostitute; (comm) wife of an accountant
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + a + kī
gaṇa + kī
Derivative taddhita (kī)
Commentary (VINa) purāṇagaṇakiyā'ti ekassa gaṇakassa bhariyāya, sā tasmiṃ jīvamāne gaṇakī'ti paññāyittha, mate pana purāṇagaṇakī'ti saṅkhaṃ gatā.
Notes thus gaṇaka + ī
Sanskrit gaṇakī
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)
gaṇacīvarasikkhāpada

gaṇato

masc. from a group; from a crowd [√gaṇ + a + to] ✓

Grammar masc, abl sg of gaṇa
Meaning from a group; from a crowd
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + a + to
gaṇa + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Commentary (VINa) gaṇato vā'ti idaṃ suttantikagaṇassa dema, idaṃ ābhidhammikagaṇassā'ti evaṃ gaṇassa denti. tato attano pattabhāgavasena gaṇato vā uppajjeyya.
Sanskrit gaṇāt
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

uppajjeyyā'ti uppajjeyya saṅghato vā gaṇato vā ñātito vā mittato vā paṃsukūlaṃ vā attano vā dhanena.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ

satiyā paccāsāyā'ti paccāsā hoti saṅghato vā gaṇato vā ñātito vā mittato vā paṃsukūlaṃ vā attano vā dhanena.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
gaṇana 1

nt. counting; reckoning; calculating [√gaṇ + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from gaṇeti
Meaning counting; reckoning; calculating
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit gaṇana
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

amhākam'pi hi, bho gotama, gaṇakānaṃ gaṇan'ājīvānaṃ dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṃ, saṅkhāne.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
gaṇana 2

nt. number (of); lit. counting [√gaṇ + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from gaṇeti
Meaning number (of); lit. counting
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)
Construction √gaṇ + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit gaṇana
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

tathārūpo ayaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhusaṅgho, tathārūpā ayaṃ, bhikkhave, parisā yathārūpaṃ parisaṃ alaṃ yojanagaṇanāni dassanāya gantuṃ puṭ'osenā'pi.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
gaṇanā 1

fem. counting; reckoning; calculating [√gaṇ + anā] ✓

Meaning counting; reckoning; calculating

Root √gaṇ･8 *e (calculate, group)

amhākam'pi hi, bho gotama, gaṇakānaṃ gaṇanā-ājīvānaṃ dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṃ, saṅkhāne.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

chandaparisuddhi, utu'kkhānaṃ, bhikkhugaṇanā ca, ovādo, uposathassa etāni, pubbakiccan'ti vuccati.

gaṇamanusāsati

pr. instructs a group; teaches a crowd [gaṇaṃ + anusāsati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning instructs a group; teaches a crowd
Construction gaṇaṃ + anusāsati
Compound comp verb (gaṇaṃ + anusāsati)
Commentary (MNa) gaṇam'anusāsantī'ti gaṇabandhanena baddhā gaṇ'ārāmā gaṇabahulikā hutvā gaṇaṃ pariharanti. evarūpā'pi ekacce atthi. tesaṃ paṭipakkhabhūtā gaṇato nissaṭā visaṃsaṭṭhā vippamuttavihārino'pi atthi.
Sanskrit gaṇam + anuśāsanti

tathā hi pana ayam'āyasmā saṅghe vā viharanto eko vā viharanto, ye ca tattha sugatā ye ca tattha duggatā, ye ca tattha gaṇam'anusāsanti, ye ca idh'ekacce āmisesu saṃdissanti, ye ca idh'ekacce āmisena anupalittā, n'āyam'āyasmā taṃ tena avajānāti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
gaṇamanusāsitumarahati

pr. is able to teach a group; is qualified to teach a group; lit. worthy of teaching a group [gaṇaṃ + anusāsituṃ + arahati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning is able to teach a group; is qualified to teach a group; lit. worthy of teaching a group
Construction gaṇaṃ + anusāsituṃ + arahati
Sanskrit gaṇa + anuśās + arhati

tatra idaṃ nissāya idaṃ pajahatha, tayo satipaṭṭhānā yadariyo sevati yadariyo sevamāno satthā gaṇam'anusāsitum'arahati, so vuccati yogg'ācariyānaṃ anuttaro purisadammasārathī'ti, ayam'uddeso saḷ'āyatanavibhaṅgassa.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
gaṇayanta

prp. (+acc) counting; calculating [√gaṇ + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of gaṇayati, trans (+acc)
Meaning counting; calculating
Root Family √gaṇ
Root √gaṇ･8 *aya (calculate, group)
Base √gaṇ + aya > gaṇaya
Construction gaṇaya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit gaṇayat
Sanskrit Root √gaṇ 10 (count)

bahum'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno,
na takkaro hoti naro pamatto,
gopo'va gāvo gaṇayaṃ paresaṃ,
na bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

Sanskrit gaṇācārya

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

ayam'pi kho ajito kesakambalo saṅghī c'eva gaṇī ca gaṇ'ācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.

na me diṭṭho ito pubbe,
na suto uda kassaci,
evaṃ vagguvado satthā,
tusitā gaṇim'āgato.

gaṇḍa 1

Grammar masc
Meaning boil; abscess; lit. swelling
Sanskrit gaṇḍa

gaṇḍo'ti kho, bhikkhave, imass'etaṃ cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa adhivacanaṃ mātāpettikasambhavassa odanakummās'ūpacayassa anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsanadhammassa.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ

so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati

Meaning swelling; bulge; bump; protuberance

VIN 2.7.5 kabaḷavaggo
gaṇḍa 3

masc. cheek [gaṇḍa] ✗
gaṇḍato

ind. as a boil; as an abscess [gaṇḍa + to] ✓

Construction gaṇḍa + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Commentary (MNa) antodos'aṭṭhena gaṇḍato
Sanskrit gaṇḍāt

so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ, te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.

AN 9.36 jhānasuttaṃ
gaṇḍabhūta

adj. like a boil; like an abscess [gaṇḍa + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a boil; like an abscess
Construction gaṇḍa + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (gaṇḍa + bhūta)
Commentary (MNa) rogo'va bhūto'ti rogabhūto. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit gaṇḍa + bhūta

ayaṃ kho pana, māgaṇḍiya, kāyo rogabhūto gaṇḍabhūto sallabhūto aghabhūto ābādhabhūto, so tvaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ rogabhūtaṃ gaṇḍabhūtaṃ sallabhūtaṃ aghabhūtaṃ ābādhabhūtaṃ, idan'taṃ, bho gotama, ārogyaṃ, idan'taṃ nibbānan'ti vadesi.

Sanskrit gaṇḍa + mūla

taṃ kho pan'etaṃ, bhikkhave, udako rāmaputto avedagū'y'eva samāno vedagū'smī'ti bhāsati, asabbajī'y'eva samāno sabbajī'smī'ti bhāsati, apalikhataṃ'y'eva gaṇḍamūlaṃ palikhataṃ me gaṇḍamūlan'ti bhāsati.

gaṇhati 1

pr. (+acc) grabs hold (of); seizes; takes [√gah + ṇhā + ti] ✓

Construction gaṇhā + ti
Synonym gheppati
Variant gaṇhāti
Sanskrit gṛhṇāti
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā ummaggaṃ gaṇhati, ubbaṭumaṃ rathaṃ karoti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho assadoso.

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave makkaṭo araññe pavane caramāno sākhaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati

Sanskrit grahṇat
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

yattha pana mahantaṃ paribhavaṃ paṭilabhati, tattha ciram'pi vasati. so nivatth'avatthe jiṇṇe pilotikakhaṇḍena tasmim'pi jiṇṇe kenaci dinnaṃ aggaṇhanto hirikopīnapaṭicchādanamatten'eva carati. evaṃ gacchante kāle ekaṃ nigamagāmaṃ agamāsi.

CPa 3.15 mahālomahaṃsacariyāvaṇṇanā
gaṇhāti 1

pr. (+acc) grabs hold (of); seizes; takes [√gah + ṇhā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning grabs hold (of); seizes; takes
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā
Construction gaṇhā + ti
Phonetic Change ha > ṇhā (Kacc 490, 518)
Synonym gheppati
Variant gaṇhati
Sanskrit gṛhṇāti
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

anatthaṃ parivajjeti,
atthaṃ gaṇhāti paṇḍito,
atth'ābhisamayā dhīro,
paṇḍito'ti pavuccatī'ti.

AN 4.42 pañhabyākaraṇasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso alagaddatthiko alagaddagavesī alagaddapariyesanaṃ caramāno. so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ bhoge vā naṅguṭṭhe vā gaṇheyya.

atha te, jarasakko amhe matte katvā mahāsamuddapiṭṭhe khipitvā amhākaṃ devanagaraṃ gaṇhi, te mayaṃ tena saddhiṃ yujjhitvā amhākaṃ devanagaram'eva gaṇhissāmā'ti kipillikā viya thambhaṃ sineruṃ anusañcaramānā uṭṭhahiṃsu.

JAa 31 kulāvaka jātakavaṇṇanā

gaha'icc'evam'ādito dhātugaṇato ppa ṇhā'icc'ete paccayā honti kattari. gheppati, gaṇhāti.

pahu santo na bharati,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6

idha, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya aparena samayena āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ āturaṃ gatayobbanaṃ khaṇḍadantaṃ palitakesaṃ, vilūnaṃ khalitasiraṃ valinaṃ tilak'āhatagattaṃ.

Phonetic Change mt > t
Sanskrit gatimat
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

seyyathā'pi, sāriputta, daḷhadhammā dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasiren'eva tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya, evaṃ adhimattasatimanto evaṃ adhimattagatimanto evaṃ adhimattadhitimanto evaṃ paramena paññāveyyattiyena samannāgatā.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
gatimant 2

adj. of perfect behaviour [√gam] ✗
gatisutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.68 (AN9.68) ✗
gatī

fem. destination; fate; destiny; future; lit. going to [√gam + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, fem nom sg, irreg form of gati
Meaning destination; fate; destiny; future; lit. going to
Root Family √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction √gam + ti
gati > gatī
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change mt > t
with metrically lengthened ī
Sanskrit gati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

apuññalābho ca gatī ca pāpikā,
bhītassa bhītāya ratī ca thokikā,
rājā ca daṇḍaṃ garukaṃ paṇeti,
tasmā naro paradāraṃ na seve.

TH 187 bhaguttheragāthā

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, ubho kaṇṇasotāni āviñjeyyāsi pāṇinā gattāni anumajjeyyāsi

āsaṃ na kubbanti kuhiñci loke.

aṭṭhakavaggo 4

kāmesu gathitā pajā'ti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 7

Meaning leash; leather strap
Variant gaddūla

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sā gaddulabaddho daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā upanibaddho. so gacchati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati. tiṭṭhati ce'pi tam'eva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭhati.

gaddulabaddhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.99 (SN22.99) ✗
gadduhanamattaṃ

ind. as long as it takes to milk a cow [go + duhana + matta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning as long as it takes to milk a cow
Construction go + duhana + matta + aṃ
gadduhanamatta + aṃ
Commentary (SNa) gadduhanamattan'ti goduhanamattaṃ, gāviyā ekavāraṃ aggathanākaḍḍhanamattan'ti attho. gandhaūhanamattaṃ vā, dvīhi aṅgulīhi gandhapiṇḍaṃ gahetvā ekavāraṃ ghāyanamattan'ti attho.
Sanskrit godohana + mātra

yo vā pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ antamaso gadduhanamattam'pi mettacittaṃ bhāveyya … idaṃ tato mahapphalataraṃ.

gaddūhanamattā

Commentary (MNa) gaddūhanamattan'ti gāviṃ thane gahetvā ekaṃ khīrabinduṃ dūhanakālamattam'pi.

adj. who was previously a vulture catcher [gaddhabādhī + pubba] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who was previously a vulture catcher
Construction gaddhabādhī + pubba

Commentary (MNa) gaddhe bādhayiṃsū'ti gaddhabādhino, gaddhabādhino pubbapurisā assā'ti gaddhabādhipubbo, tassa gaddhabādhipubbassa, gijjhaghātakakulappasutassā'ti attho.
Sanskrit gṛdhra + bādhin + pūrva

tena kho pana samayena ariṭṭhassa nāma bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti, tath'āhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā ye'me antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato n'ālaṃ antarāyāyā'ti.

AN 3.30 avakujjasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi disaṃ peseti, yadi vā gatapubbaṃ yadi vā agatapubbaṃ, taṃ khippam'eva gantā hoti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo gantā hoti.

gantar 2

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
gantukāma

adj. (+acc or +dat) wishing to go (to); wanting to go (to) [gantuṃ + kāma] ✓

Construction gantuṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (gantuṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit gantukāma

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, brāhmaṇa, idha puriso āgaccheyya rājagahaṃ gantu'kāmo. so taṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, icchām'ahaṃ, bhante, rājagahaṃ gantuṃ, tassa me rājagahassa maggaṃ upadisā'ti.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

accekacīvaraṃ nāma senāya vā gantu'kāmo hoti, pavāsaṃ vā gantu'kāmo hoti, gilāno vā hoti, gabbhinī vā hoti, assaddhassa vā saddhā uppannā hoti, appasannassa vā pasādo uppanno hoti

VIN 1.4.3.8 accekacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ

Sanskrit gantum + arhati

gandha 1

masc. smell; scent; odour [√ghā + na] ✓

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

ghānena gandhaṃ ghāyitvā piyarūpe gandhe adhimuccati, appiyarūpe gandhe byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.

Sanskrit Root √ghrā 1, 2, 3 (smell)

na pupphagandho paṭivātam'eti,
na candanaṃ tagaramallikā,
satañ'ca gandho paṭivātam'eti,
sabbā disā sappuriso pavāyati.

DHP 54 pupphavaggo

nacca-gīta-vādita-visūka-dassanā paṭivirato hoti mālā-gandha-vilepana-dhāraṇa-maṇḍana-vibhūsana-ṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti

Root √ghā･3 ya (smell)
Construction √ghā + na

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

masc. stream of consciousness impelled to be reborn ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning stream of consciousness impelled to be reborn
Commentary (MNa) gandhabbo'ti tatr'ūpagasatto. paccupaṭṭhito hotī'ti na mātāpitūnaṃ sannipātaṃ olokayamāno samīpe ṭhito paccupaṭṭhito nāma hoti. kammayantayantito pana eko satto tasmiṃ okāse nibbattanako hotī'ti ayam'ettha adhippāyo.
Sanskrit gandharva

tiṇṇaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, sannipātā gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti. idha mātā'pitaro ca sannipatitā honti, mātā ca na utunī hoti, gandhabbo ca na paccupaṭṭhito hoti, n'eva tāva gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti.

Meaning conception; lit. descent of the foetus
Construction gabbhassa + avakkanti
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gabbhassa + avakkanti)
Commentary (MNa) gabbhassā'ti gabbhe nibbattanakasattassa. avakkanti hotī'ti nibbatti hoti.
Sanskrit garbhāvakrānti

tiṇṇaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, sannipātā gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti. idha mātā'pitaro ca sannipatitā honti, mātā ca na utunī hoti, gandhabbo ca na paccupaṭṭhito hoti, n'eva tāva gabbhass'āvakkanti hoti.

gabbhāvakkanti

gabbhī + inī

Sanskrit garbhiṇī

accekacīvaraṃ nāma senāya vā gantu'kāmo hoti, pavāsaṃ vā gantu'kāmo hoti, gilāno vā hoti, gabbhinī vā hoti, assaddhassa vā saddhā uppannā hoti, appasannassa vā pasādo uppanno hoti

VIN 1.4.3.8 accekacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, bārāṇasiyaṃ aññatarassa chapakassa pajāpati gabbhinī ahosi. atha kho, bhikkhave, sā chapakī taṃ chapakaṃ etadavoca, gabbhinī'mhi, ayyaputta!

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo

Meaning pregnant woman
Construction gabbha + ī + iṇī
gabbhī + inī

Commentary (DNa) na gabbhiniyā'tiādīsu pana gabbhiniyā kucchiyaṃ dārako kilamati. pāyantiyā dārakassa khīr'antarāyo hoti, puris'antaragatāya ratiantarāyo hotī'ti na gaṇhati.
Sanskrit garbhiṇī

te na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na eḷakam'antaraṃ na daṇḍam'antaraṃ na musalam'antaraṃ na dvinnaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ na gabbhiniyā na pāyamānāya na puris'antaragatāya

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhante, aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa jiṇṇassa vuḍḍhassa mahallakassa daharā māṇavikā pajāpatī ahosi gabbhinī upavijaññā.

gamesi

aor. made go, sent, understood [√gam] ✗
gambhīra 1

adj. deep ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning deep
Synonym gambhīrarūpa
Sanskrit gambhīra

seyyathā'pi, gāmaṇi, puriso mahatiṃ puthusilaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya.

yathā'pi rahado gambhīro,
vippasanno anāvilo,
evaṃ dhammāni sutvāna,
vippasīdanti paṇḍitā.

Meaning deep water; depths; lit. deep

appatiṭṭhe anālambe,
ko gambhīre na sīdatī'ti.

gambhīra 3

Meaning profound; abstruse; hard to fathom; lit. deep

Sanskrit gambhīra

gambhīrapaññaṃ medhāviṃ,
magg'āmaggassa kovidaṃ,
uttam'attham'anuppattaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 403 brāhmaṇavaggo

aṭṭh'aṅgasamannāgato kho pan'assa bhoto gotamassa mukhato ghoso niccharati, vissaṭṭho ca, viññeyyo ca, mañju ca, savanīyo ca, bindu ca, avisārī ca, gambhīro ca, ninnādī ca.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
gambhīra 5

nt. deep pit; deep hole; lit. deep ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning deep pit; deep hole; lit. deep
Commentary (KPa) atthi gambhīrañ'c'eva odak'antikañ'ca jaṅgale bhūmibhāge yāva idāni udakaṃ āgamissatī'ti, tāva khato āvāṭo viya. taṃ sandhāya idaṃ vuttaṃ gambhīre odakantike'ti.
Sanskrit gambhīra

nidhiṃ nidheti puriso,
gambhīre odak'antike,
atthe kicce samuppanne,
atthāya me bhavissati.

Commentary (PM) gambhīrapaññatāya saṃvattantī'ti katamā gambhīrapaññā? gambhīresu khandhesu ñāṇaṃ pavattatī'ti, gambhīrapaññā. gambhīrāsu dhātūsu ñāṇaṃ pavattatī'ti, gambhīrapaññā. gambhīresu āyatanesu ñāṇaṃ pavattatī'ti, gambhīrapaññā. gambhīresu paṭiccasamuppādesu ñāṇaṃ pavattatī'ti, gambhīrapaññā.
gambhīrapaññāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 55.65 (SN55.65) ✗
gambhīrapañha

nt. deep question; profound enquiry [gambhīra + pañha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning deep question; profound enquiry
Construction gambhīra + pañha
Compound kammadhāraya (gambhīra + pañha)
Commentary (JAa) gambhīrapañhan'ti atthato ca pāḷito ca gambhīraṃ guḷhaṃ paṭicchannaṃ
Sanskrit gambhīra + praśna

acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso! yathā taṃ sutavatā sāvakena samma'd'eva satthusāsanaṃ ājānantena, evam'eva āyasmatā puṇṇena mantāṇiputtena gambhīrā gambhīrapañhā anumassa anumassa byākatā.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
gambhīrarūpa

adj. deep; lit. deep in form [gambhīra + rūpa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning deep; lit. deep in form
Construction gambhīra + rūpa
Synonym gambhīra
Commentary (SNa) gambhīrarūpe'ti gambhīrasabhāve.
gambhīrasita

adj. deeply furrowed; with a deep plough track [gambhīra + sītā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning deeply furrowed; with a deep plough track
Construction gambhīra + sītā + a
gambhīrasītā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (gambhīra + sītā)
Commentary (ANa) na ca gambhīrasitan'ti thaddhabhūmitāya gambhīr'ānugataṃ, naṅgalamaggaṃ katvā kasituṃ na sakkā hoti, uttānanaṅgalamaggam'eva hoti.
Sanskrit gambhīra + sītā

idha, bhikkhave, khettaṃ unnāmaninnāmi ca hoti, pāsāṇasakkharikañ'ca hoti, ūsarañ'ca hoti, na ca gambhīrasitaṃ hoti, na āyasampannaṃ hoti, na apāyasampannaṃ hoti, na mātikāsampannaṃ hoti, na mariyādasampannaṃ hoti.

AN 8.34 khettasuttaṃ
gambhīraṃ

ind. deeply [gambhīra + aṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, acc sg of gambhīra
Meaning deeply
Construction gambhīra + aṃ
Sanskrit gambhīram
gambhīrāvabhāsa

adj. having the appearance of depth or profundity ✗
gambhīrobhāsa

adj. appearing deep; seemingly deep [gambhīra + obhāsa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning appearing deep; seemingly deep
Construction gambhīra + obhāsa
Commentary (ANa) uttāno gambhīr'obhāso'tiādīsu purāṇa-paṇṇa-rasa-sambhinna-vaṇṇo kāḷaudako gambhīr'obhāso nāma, accha-vippasanna-maṇivaṇṇa-udako uttān'obhāso nāma.
gamma 1

adj. vulgar; common; lit. of the village [gāma + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from gāma
Meaning vulgar; common; lit. of the village
Construction gāma + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
Sanskrit grāmya

na kāmasukham'anuyuñjeyya hīnaṃ gammaṃ pothujjanikaṃ anariyaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ, na ca attakilamath'ānuyogam'anuyuñjeyya dukkhaṃ anariyaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
gamma 2

ptp. what should be understood or attained [√gam] ✗
gayā 1

fem. name of a village ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a village
Sanskrit gayā

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, sabbaṃ, bhikkhave, ādittaṃ.

SN 35.28 ādittasuttaṃ

addasā kho maṃ, bhikkhave, upako ājīvako antarā ca gayaṃ antarā ca bodhiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannaṃ. disvāna maṃ etadavoca, vippasannāni kho te, āvuso, indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto!

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
gayā 2

fem. name of a sacred river; (comm) circular pond ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a sacred river; (comm) circular pond
Commentary (MNa) gayā'ti'pi maṇḍalavāpisaṇṭhānaṃ tittham'eva vuccati.
Sanskrit gayā

bāhukaṃ adhikakkañ'ca,
gayaṃ sundarikaṃ m'api,
sarassatiṃ payāgañ'ca,
atho bāhumatiṃ nadiṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
gayākassapattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 204 (TH204) ✗
gayāsīsa

nt. name of a rock hill near Gayā; lit. Gayā's head [gayā + sīsa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a rock hill near Gayā; lit. Gayā's head
Construction gayā + sīsa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gayāyaṃ + sīsa)
Commentary (UDa) gayāsīse'ti gajasīsasadisasikharo tattha eko pabbato gayāsīsanāmako, yattha hatthikumbhasadiso piṭṭhipāsāṇo bhikkhusahassassa okāso pahoti, tatra bhagavā viharati.
Sanskrit gayāśīrṣa (bsk)

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā gayāyaṃ viharati gayāsīse saddhiṃ bhikkhusahassena. tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, sabbaṃ, bhikkhave, ādittaṃ.

SN 35.28 ādittasuttaṃ
gayāsīsasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.64 (AN8.64) ✗
gayhaka 1

masc. captive; prisoner; hostage; lit. who is seized [√gah + ya + aka] ~

Grammar masc, agent, from gayhati, pass
Meaning captive; prisoner; hostage; lit. who is seized
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ya (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ya > gayha (pass)
Construction gayha + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Synonym baddha, karamara
Commentary (SNa) gayhakaṃ nīyamānan'ti gahetvā nīyamānaṃ, karamaraṃ nīyamānan'ti'pi attho.
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)
gayhaka 2

adj. having seized, captured [√gah] ✗
gayhati 1

pr. (+instr) (gram) is employed (by); is used (by); lit. is grasped [√gah + ya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of gaṇhāti, intrans (+instr)
Meaning (gram) is employed (by); is used (by); lit. is grasped
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ya (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ya > gayha (pass)
Construction gayha + ti
Phonetic Change hy > yh (metathesis)
Sanskrit gṛhyate
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)
gayhati 2

pr. (+instr) is taken or seized [√gah] ✗
gayhamāna

prp. was being taken or seized [√gah] ✗
garahati

pr. (+acc) criticises; abuses; blames [√garah + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning criticises; abuses; blames
Root Family √garah
Root √garah･1 a (blame)
Base √garah + a > garaha
Construction garaha + ti
Sanskrit garhati
Sanskrit Root √garh 1 (chide)

so bhuttāvī anumodati, na taṃ bhattaṃ garahati, na aññaṃ bhattaṃ paṭikaṅkhati, añña'd'atthu dhammiyā kathāya taṃ parisaṃ sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

sammādiṭṭhiṃ ce bhavaṃ garahati, ye ca micchādiṭṭhī samaṇabrāhmaṇā te bhoto pujjā, te bhoto pāsaṃsā.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ
garahanta

prp. reproaching, blaming, scolding [√garah] ✗
garahappatta

adj. blamed; criticised [garahā + patta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning blamed; criticised
Construction garahā + patta
garahamāna

prp. reproaching, blaming, scolding [√garah] ✗
garahā

fem. blame; criticism [√garah + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from garahati
Meaning blame; criticism
Root Family √garah
Root √garah･1 a (blame)
Construction √garah + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Antonym pasaṃsā, pasaṃsana
Sanskrit garhā
Sanskrit Root √garh 1 (chide)

dummedhehi pasaṃsā ca,
viññūhi garahā ca yā,
garahā'va seyyo viññūhi,
yaṃ ce bālappasaṃsanā.

TH 245 godattattheragāthā

passati hi so, bhikkhave, gopālako tatonidānaṃ vadhaṃ vā bandhanaṃ vā jāniṃ vā garahaṃ vā.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
garahi

aor. reproached, blamed, scolded [√garah] ✗
garahita

pp. blamed; criticized [√garah + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of garahati
Meaning blamed; criticized
Root Family √garah
Root √garah･1 a (blame)
Construction √garah + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym nindita
Sanskrit garhita
Sanskrit Root √garh 1 (chide)

appamādena maghavā,
devānaṃ seṭṭhataṃ gato,
appamādaṃ pasaṃsanti,
pamādo garahito sadā.

DHP 30 appamādavaggo

puggal'ānādariyaṃ nāma upasampannena paññattena vuccamāno ayaṃ ukkhittako vā vambhito vā garahito vā, imassa vacanaṃ akataṃ bhavissatī'ti anādariyaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.6.4 anādariyasikkhāpadaṃ
garahitabba

ptp. should be blamed; could be criticised; lit. to be blamed [√garah + itabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of garahati
Meaning should be blamed; could be criticised; lit. to be blamed
Root Family √garah
Root √garah･1 a (blame)
Construction √garah + itabba
Derivative kicca (itabba)
Sanskrit garhitavya
Sanskrit Root √garh 1 (chide)

te'p'ime tayo niruttipathe adhivacanapathe paññattipathe na garahitabbaṃ nappaṭikkositabbaṃ amaññiṃsu. taṃ kissa hetu? nindā-ghaṭṭana-byārosa-upārambha-bhayā'ti.

SN 22.62 niruttipathasuttaṃ

yo hi koci, bhikkhave, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā imaṃ mahācattārīsakaṃ dhammapariyāyaṃ garahitabbaṃ paṭikkositabbaṃ maññeyya tassa diṭṭh'eva dhamme dasasahadhammikā vād'ānuvādā gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgacchanti

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ
garahī

adj. criticising; blaming [√garah + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from garahati
Meaning criticising; blaming
Root Family √garah
Root √garah･1 a (blame)
Construction √garah + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Sanskrit garhin
Sanskrit Root √garh 1 (chide)

yo sugatesu manaṃ padosaye,
sataṃ sahassānaṃ nirabbudānaṃ,
chattiṃsatī pañca ca abbudāni,
yam'ariyagarahī nirayaṃ upeti,
vācaṃ manañ'ca paṇidhāya pāpakan'ti.

AN 4.3 paṭhamakhatasuttaṃ

ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ,
phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yadattagarahī tadakubbamāno,
na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
garu 1

adj. heavy; onerous; weighty [√gar + u] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning heavy; onerous; weighty
Root Family √gar
Root √gar×1 a (esteem, be heavy)
Construction √gar + u
Derivative kita (u)
Antonym agaru
Synonym garuka
Sanskrit guru
Sanskrit Root √gur 6 (raise)

nikkhipitvā garuṃ bhāraṃ,
aññaṃ bhāraṃ anādiya,
samūlaṃ taṇham'abbuyha,
nicchāto parinibbuto'ti.

SN 22.22 bhārasuttaṃ
garu 2

Meaning serious; burdensome; difficult; problematic; lit. heavy

Root √gar×1 a (esteem, be heavy)
Construction √gar + u
Derivative kita (u)
Antonym agaru
Sanskrit guru
Sanskrit Root √gur 6 (raise)

sace te, bhaggava, agaru viharemu āvesane ekarattan'ti. na kho me, bhante, garu. atthi c'ettha pabbajito paṭhamaṃ vās'ūpagato. sace so anujānāti, viharatha, bhante, yathāsukhan'ti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

sace te kassapa agaru, viharemu ajjaṇho aggisālamhī'ti

VIN 4.1.12 uruvela pāṭihāriya kathā

ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo c'assaṃ manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā'ti, sīlesv'ev'assa paripūrakārī ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno vipassanāya samannāgato brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ.

AN 10.71 ākaṅkhasuttaṃ

āyasmā'ti piyavacanaṃ garuvacanaṃ sagāravasappatissādhivacanam'etaṃ āyasmā'ti.

AN 2.9 cariyasuttaṃ

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

garuka 1

adj. heavy; onerous; weighty [√gar + u + ka] ✓

Sanskrit Root √gur 6 (raise)

pariciṇṇo mayā satthā,

ohito garuko bhāro,
bhavanetti samūhatā.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso garukaṃ silāguḷaṃ allamattikāpuñje pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu taṃ garukaṃ silāguḷaṃ allamattikāpuñje labhetha otāran'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

DHP 138 daṇḍavaggo

apuññalābho ca gatī ca pāpikā,
bhītassa bhītāya ratī ca thokikā,
rājā ca daṇḍaṃ garukaṃ paṇeti,
tasmā naro paradāraṃ na seve.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
garukata

pp. respected; honoured; revered; lit. made heavy [garu + kata] ✓

Grammar pp of garukaroti, comp vb
Meaning respected; honoured; revered; lit. made heavy
Construction garu + kata
Compound comp verb (garu + kata)
Antonym agarukata
Sanskrit gurukṛta

dibbāni'pi saṅgītāni antalikkhe vattanti tathāgatassa pūjāya. na kho, ānanda, ettāvatā tathāgato sakkato vā hoti garukato vā mānito vā pūjito vā apacito vā.

DN 16.27 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena bāhiyo dārucīriyo suppārake paṭivasati samuddatīre sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito lābhī cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānapaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
garukatvā

abs. having honoured; having esteemed; having paid respect [garu + katvā] ~

Grammar abs of garuṃ karoti, comp vb
Meaning having honoured; having esteemed; having paid respect
Construction garu + katvā
garukaraṇa

adj. which creates respect; which makes one revered [garu + karaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which creates respect; which makes one revered
Construction garu + karaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (garuṃ + karaṇa)
Commentary (ANa) yo te dhamme pūreti, taṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ ... garuṃ karontī'ti garukaraṇā.
Sanskrit guru + karaṇa

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca, ayam'pi dhammo sāraṇīyo piyakaraṇo garukaraṇo saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.

AN 6.12 dutiyasāraṇīyasuttaṃ
garukari

aor. respected, revered ✗
garukariyamāna

prp. (+instr) being respected (by); being honoured (by); being revered (by) [garu + kariyamāna] ✓

Grammar prp of garukarīyati, comp vb, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being respected (by); being honoured (by); being revered (by)
Construction garu + kariyamāna
Compound comp verb (garu + kariyamāna)
Sanskrit gurum + kriyamāṇa

etha, tumhe bhikkhū sīlavante kalyāṇadhamme sakkarotha garuṃ karotha mānetha pūjetha, app'eva nāma tumhehi sakkariyamānānaṃ garukariyamānānaṃ māniyamānānaṃ pūjiyamānānaṃ siyā cittassa aññathattaṃ, yathā taṃ dūsī māro labhetha otāran'ti.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
garukaroti

pr. respects, reveres ✗
garukaronta

Grammar prp of garukaroti, comp vb
Meaning respecting; honouring; revering; lit. making heavy
Construction garu + karonta
Compound comp verb (garu + karonta)
Variant garuṃ karonta
Sanskrit guru + kurvat

yo ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṃ'y'eva sakkaronto, dhammaṃ garukaronto, dhammaṃ mānento, dhammaṃ pūjento, dhammaṃ apacāyamāno suvaco hoti, sovacassataṃ āpajjati, tam'ahaṃ suvaco'ti vadāmi.

garukāpatti

Sanskrit guruka + āpatti

idh'upāli, bhikkhū anāpattiṃ āpattī'ti dīpenti, āpattiṃ anāpattī'ti dīpenti, lahukaṃ āpattiṃ garuk'āpattī'ti dīpenti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ lahuk'āpattī'ti dīpenti

AN 10.43 dutiyavivādamūlasuttaṃ
garukāra

masc. respect; reverence; adoration; lit. making heavy [garu + kāra] ✓

Meaning respect; reverence; adoration; lit. making heavy

Sanskrit gurukāra

āmisahetū'ti cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu sen'āsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu.

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
garukārahetu

ind. for the sake of reverence; for the sake of adoration [garukāra + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of reverence; for the sake of adoration
Construction garukāra + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (garukārassa + hetu)
Sanskrit gurukāra + hetu

āmisahetū'ti cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu sen'āsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu.

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
garugabbhā

adj. very pregnant; due; lit. heavy womb [garu + gabbhā] ✓

Grammar adj, fem, comp of garugabbha
Meaning very pregnant; due; lit. heavy womb
Construction garu + gabbhā
Compound kammadhāraya (garu + gabbhā)
Sanskrit guru + garbha

tadā seṭṭhino bhariyā garugabbhā hoti. tasmā so sīghaṃ gehaṃ purisaṃ pesesi, gaccha bhaṇe, jānāhi naṃ vijātā vā, no vā'ti.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
garugara

adj. very heavy; extremely full [garu + garu + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning very heavy; extremely full
Construction garu + garu + a
garugaru + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (MNa) garugaro viyā'ti garukagaruko viya thaddho pāsāṇapuñjasadiso
Sanskrit guru + guru

tena kho pana samayena māro pāpimā āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa kucchigato hoti koṭṭham'anupaviṭṭho. atha kho āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa etadahosi, kiṃ nu kho me kucchi garugaro viya mās'ācitaṃ maññe'ti.

Sanskrit go + ākalpa

so govataṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gosīlaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gocittaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gav'ākappaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā gunnaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.

DHP 154 jarāvaggo
gaha 3

masc. view [√gah] ✗
gaha 4

root. (gram) √gah (grasp) [√gah + a] ✓

Grammar root, masc
Meaning (gram) √gah (grasp)
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit grah, gṛbh
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

gaha'icc'etassa dhātussa sabbassa ghekāro hoti ppapaccaye pare. gheppati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 489

gaha'icc'etassa dhātussa hakārassa lopo hoti ṇhāmhi paccaye pare. gaṇhāti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 490

yan'dunnimittaṃ avamaṅgalañ'ca, yo c'āmanāpo sakuṇassa saddo, pāpaggaho dussupinaṃ akantaṃ, buddh'ānubhāvena vināsamentu

Trad

gahaka

nt. body; lit. small house [√gah + a + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, dimin of gaha
Meaning body; lit. small house
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah + a + ka
gaha + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (THa) aniccāni gahakāni, tattha tattha punappunan'ti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ bhave punappunaṃ nibbattamānāni gahakāni attabhāvagehāni na nibbāni anavaṭṭhitāni ittarāni parittakālāni.
Sanskrit gṛhaka
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

aniccāni gahakāni,
tattha tattha punappunaṃ,
gahakāraṃ gavesanto,
dukkhā jāti punappunaṃ.

TH 152 sivakattheragāthā

anekajātisaṃsāraṃ,
sandhāvissaṃ anibbisaṃ,
gahakāraṃ gavesanto,
dukkhā jāti punappunaṃ.

DHP 153 jarāvaggo
gahakāraka

puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,

visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ,
taṇhānaṃ khayamajjhagā.

tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

yo buddhaṃ paribhāsati,
atha vā tassa sāvakaṃ,
paribbājaṃ gahaṭṭhaṃ vā,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

imaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiṃ evaṃ parisuddhaṃ evaṃ pariyodātaṃ allīyetha kelāyetha dhanāyetha mamāyetha, api nu me tumhe, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājāneyyātha nittharaṇ'atthāya no gahaṇ'atthāyā'ti?

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
gahaṇī 1

fem. digestion; lit. grasper [√gah + aṇa + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from gahaṇa
Meaning digestion; lit. grasper
Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Construction √gah + aṇa + ī
gahaṇa + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Commentary (DNa) gahaṇiyā'ti kammajatejodhātuyā. tattha yassa bhuttabhutto āhāro jīrati, yassa vā pana puṭabhattaṃ viya tatheva tiṭṭhati, ubhopete na samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgatā. yassa pana bhuttakāle bhattacchando uppajjat'eva, ayaṃ samavepākiniyā samannāgato.
Sanskrit grahaṇī
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu app'ābādho hoti app'ātaṅko, samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgato n'ātisītāya n'āccuṇhāya majjhimāya padhānakkhamāya. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo samayo padhānāya.

idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito ca hoti, gahananissito ca hoti, balavanissito ca hoti. kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito hoti?

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

kiṃ te jaṭāhi dummedha,
kiṃ te ajinasāṭiyā,
abbhantaraṃ te gahanaṃ,
bāhiraṃ parimajjasī'ti.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro tiṇagahanaṃ vā nissito hoti, rukkhagahanaṃ vā rodhaṃ vā mahāvanasaṇḍaṃ vā.

Sanskrit gṛhapatika (bsk)
gahapataggi

masc. fire (of hell for the unfaithful wife) of a householder; lit. household fire [gahapati + aggi] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fire (of hell for the unfaithful wife) of a householder; lit. household fire
Construction gahapati + aggi
Commentary (DNa) gahapatī'ti pana gehasāmiko vuccati. So mātugāmassa sayanavatth'ālaṅkār'ādianuppadānena bah'ūpakāro. taṃ aticaranto mātugāmo niray'ādīsu nibbattati, tasmā so'pi purimanayen'eva anudahan'aṭṭhena gahapat'aggī'ti vutto.
Sanskrit gṛhapati + agni
gahapatānī

fem. householder’s wife; lady of the house [gaha + pati + anī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp, from gahapati
Meaning householder’s wife; lady of the house
Construction gaha + pati + anī
gahapati + anī
Derivative taddhita (anī)
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gahassa + patānī)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.6) gahapatānī nāma yā kāci agāraṃ ajjhāvasati. (MNa) gahapatānī'ti gharasāminī.
Sanskrit gṛhapatnī

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, imissā'y'eva sāvatthiyā vedehikā nāma gahapatānī ahosi. vedehikāya, bhikkhave, gahapatāniyā evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato, soratā vedehikā gahapatānī, nivātā vedehikā gahapatānī, upasantā vedehikā gahapatānī'ti.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ

tañ'ce aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā bahūhi cīvarehi abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, santar'uttaraparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tato cīvaraṃ sāditabbaṃ. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 7 tatuttarisikkhāpadaṃ
gahapati

masc. householder; landowner; lit. house master [gaha + pati] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning householder; landowner; lit. house master
Construction gaha + pati
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gahassa + pati)
Synonym gahapatika
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.6) gahapati nāma yo koci agāraṃ ajjhāvasati.
Sanskrit gṛhapati

sakkā ca pan'etaṃ abhavissa kātuṃ gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā antamaso kumbhadāsiyā'pi, hand'āhaṃ acelako homi, mutt'ācāro, hatth'āpalekhano

DN 8.5 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

tena hi, gahapati, taññ'ev'ettha paṭipucchissāmi, yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsi.

yam'pi no saddhā gahapatikā divā vikāle paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā denti, tatra'p'ime mukh'āvaraṇaṃ maññe karontī'ti.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

ko nu kho bho kaccāna hetu ko paccayo yena khattiyā'pi khattiyehi vivadanti brāhmaṇā'pi brāhmaṇehi vivadanti gahapatikā'pi gahapatikehi vivadantī'ti?

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, khattiyakaññā vā brāhmaṇakaññā vā gahapatikaññā vā pannarasavass'uddesikā vā soḷasavass'uddesikā vā, n'ātidīghā n'ātirassā n'ātikisā n'ātithūlā n'ātikāḷī n'āccodātā paramā sā, bhikkhave, tasmiṃ samaye subhā vaṇṇanibhāti?

gahapatikula

gahapaticīvara

nt. robe offered by a householder [gahapati + cīvara] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning robe offered by a householder
Construction gahapati + cīvara
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gahapatino + cīvara)
Commentary (VINa) gahapaticīvaran'ti gahapatīhi dinnacīvaraṃ.
Sanskrit gṛhapati + cīvara

yassa kassaci, āvuso, bhikkhuno ime pāpakā akusalā icch'āvacarā pahīnā dissanti c'eva sūyanti ca, kiñ'c'āpi so hoti gām'antavihārī nemantaniko gahapaticīvaradharo, atha kho naṃ sabrahmacārī sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti.

yassa kassaci, āvuso, bhikkhuno ime pāpakā akusalā icch'āvacarā pahīnā dissanti c'eva sūyanti ca, kiñ'c'āpi so hoti gām'antavihārī nemantaniko gahapaticīvaradharo, atha kho naṃ sabrahmacārī sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti.

gahapatinecayika

nt. tradesman who is a skilful accumulator; rich tradesman ✗

rakkhass'etaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, vācaṃ, rakkhass'etaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, vācaṃ. bahū hi tassa bhoto gotamassa khattiyapaṇḍitā'pi brāhmaṇapaṇḍitā'pi gahapatipaṇḍitā'pi samaṇapaṇḍitā'pi abhippasannā vinītā ariye ñāye dhamme kusale'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

puna capar'āhaṃ, bho, passāmi idh'ekacce gahapatipaṇḍite nipuṇe kataparappavāde vālavedhirūpe te bhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhigatāni.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
gahapatiparisā

fem. assembly of householders; meeting of householders [gahapatī + parisā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning assembly of householders; meeting of householders
Construction gahapatī + parisā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gahapatīnaṃ + parisā)
Sanskrit gṛhapati + pariṣad

puna caparaṃ, sīha, dāyako dānapati yaṃ yadeva parisaṃ upasaṅkamati, yadi khattiyaparisaṃ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṃ yadi gahapatiparisaṃ yadi samaṇaparisaṃ, visārado'va upasaṅkamati amaṅkubhūto.

AN 5.35 dānānisaṃsasuttaṃ

aṭṭha kho imā, sāriputta, parisā. katamā aṭṭha? khattiyaparisā, brāhmaṇaparisā, gahapatiparisā, samaṇaparisā, cātumahārājikaparisā, tāvatiṃsaparisā, māraparisā, brahmaparisā, imā kho, sāriputta, aṭṭha parisā.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

Synonym kulaputta
Sanskrit gṛhapati + putra

so tattha passati gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitaṃ samaṅgībhūtaṃ paricārayamānaṃ.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

sakkā ca pan'etaṃ abhavissa kātuṃ gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā antamaso kumbhadāsiyā'pi, hand'āhaṃ acelako homi, mutt'ācāro, hatth'āpalekhano

DN 8.5 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
gahapatimahāsāla

masc. wealthy householder; rich businessman; lit. householder with a big hall [gahapati + mahāsāla] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wealthy householder; rich businessman; lit. householder with a big hall
Construction gahapati + mahāsāla
Compound kammadhāraya (gahapati + mahāsāla)
Commentary (SNa) yesaṃ gahapatīnaṃ cattālīsakoṭidhanaṃ nihitaṃ hoti, kahāpaṇakumbho valañjan'atthāya gehamajjhe rāsiṃ katvā ṭhapito hoti, te gahapatimahāsālā nāma.
Sanskrit gṛhapati + mahāśāla

ye'pi te, mahārāja, gahapatimahāsālā aḍḍhā mahaddhanā mahābhogā pahūtajātarūparajatā pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇā pahūtadhanadhaññā, tesam'pi jātānaṃ n'atthi aññatra jarāmaraṇā.

SN 3.3 jarāmaraṇasuttaṃ

idh'āhaṃ, bhante, aḍḍakaraṇe nisinno passāmi khattiyamahāsāle'pi brāhmaṇamahāsāle'pi gahapatimahāsāle'pi aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ sampajānamusā bhāsante.

SN 3.7 aḍḍakaraṇasuttaṃ
gahapatimahāsālakula

nt. very wealthy householder family [gahapati + mahāsāla + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning very wealthy householder family
Construction gahapati + mahāsāla + kula
Compound kammadhāraya (gahapatimahāsāla + kula)
Sanskrit gṛhapati + mahāśāla + kula

idh'ānanda, ekacco ucce kule paccājāto hoti, khattiyamahāsālakule vā brāhmaṇamahāsālakule vā gahapatimahāsālakule vā, aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
gahapatiratana

nt. steward treasure; householder treasure; one of the seven treasures of a universal ruler [gahapati + ratana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning steward treasure; householder treasure; one of the seven treasures of a universal ruler
Construction gahapati + ratana
Compound kammadhāraya (gahapati + ratana)
Sanskrit gṛhapati + ratna

tass'imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti, seyyath'idaṃ, cakkaratanaṃ, hatthiratanaṃ, assaratanaṃ, maṇiratanaṃ, itthiratanaṃ, gahapatiratanaṃ, pariṇāyakaratanam'eva sattamaṃ.

evaṃ vutte, potaliyo gahapati gahapativādena maṃ samaṇo gotamo samudācaratī'ti kupito anattamano tuṇhī ahosi.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
gahapatisahassa

nt. one thousand householders ✗
gahavibhava

masc. domestic property or wealth ✗
gahāyanta

prp. (+acc) picking up; grabbing hold (of); grasping [√gah + ṇhā + nta] ✓

Root Family √gah
Root √gah･6 ṇhā (grasp)
√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + ṇhā > gaṇhā > gahāya (irreg)
Construction gahāya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Antonym pamuñcanta
Sanskrit grāhayat
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

purimaṃ pahāya aparaṃ sitāse,
ej'ānugā te na taranti saṅgaṃ,
te uggahāyanti nirassajanti,
kapī'va sākhaṃ pamuñcaṃ gahāyaṃ.

upasaṅkamitvā kummaṃ kacchapaṃ paccupaṭṭhito ahosi, yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ

yaṃ pubbe taṃ visosehi,
pacchā te m'āhu kiñcanaṃ,
majjhe ce no gahessasi,
upasanto carissasi.

SNP 66 jatukaṇṇi māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 11
gahvaratīriyattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 31 (TH31) ✗
gaḷa

adj. dripping; oozing [√gal + a] ~

Meaning dripping; oozing
Root Family √gal
Root √gal･1 a (drip, flow)

Phonetic Change l > ḷ
Variant gala
Sanskrit gala
Sanskrit Root √gal 1 (drop)
gaḷagaḷāyati

pr. thunders; lit. makes a gaḷagaḷa sound [gaḷagaḷa + āya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, onom, deno of gaḷagalā, intrans
Meaning thunders; lit. makes a gaḷagaḷa sound
Construction gaḷagaḷa + āya + ti

devo ca vassati devo ca gaḷagaḷāyati,
ekako c'āhaṃ bherave bile viharāmi,
tassa mayhaṃ ekakassa bherave bile viharato,
n'atthi bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā.

idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā

MN 86 aṅgulimālasuttaṃ

atha kho, pāpima, āyasmā vidhuro bhinnena sīsena lohitena gaḷantena kakusandhaṃ'y'eva bhagavantaṃ arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhi.

anatthapadasaṃhitā,

yaṃ sutvā upasammati.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
gāthā 3

fem. deep [√gā] ✗
gāthācimā

sandhi. and this verse; and this poem [gāthā + ca + imā] ✓

Construction gāthā + ca + imā
Sanskrit gāthā + ca + ima

idh'āgamā vijjupabhāsavaṇṇā,
kokanadā pajjunnassa dhītā,
buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca namassamānā,
gāthā'c'imā atthavatī abhāsi.

SN 1.40 dutiyapajjunnadhītusuttaṃ
gāthādvaya

nt. pair of verses [gāthā + dvaya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning pair of verses
Construction gāthā + dvaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāthāya + dvaya)
Sanskrit gāthā + dvaya
gāthānamāsaya

masc. home of verses; abode of poetry; (comm) support for poetry [gāthānaṃ + āsaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning home of verses; abode of poetry; (comm) support for poetry
Construction gāthānaṃ + āsaya
Compound alutta chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāthānaṃ + āsaya)
Commentary (SNa) āsayo'ti patiṭṭhā. kavito hi gāthā pavattanti. so tāsaṃ patiṭṭhā hotī'ti.
Sanskrit gāthānām + āśraya

kiṃsu nidānaṃ gāthānaṃ,
kiṃsu tāsaṃ viyañjanaṃ,
kiṃsu sannissitā gāthā,
kiṃsu gāthānam'āsayo'ti.

SN 1.60 kavisuttaṃ

chando nidānaṃ gāthānaṃ,
akkharā tāsaṃ viyañjanaṃ,
nāmasannissitā gāthā,
kavi gāthānam'āsayo'ti.

gāthāpada

Meaning line of verse

Sanskrit gāthā + pada

sahassam'api ce gāthā,
anatthapadasaṃhitā,
ekaṃ gāthāpadaṃ seyyo,
yaṃ sutvā upasammati.

DHP 101 sahassavaggo
gāthābhigīta

adj. chanted over with verses; recited over [gāthā + abhigīta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning chanted over with verses; recited over
Construction gāthā + abhigīta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (gāthāya + abhigīta)
Sanskrit gāthā + abhigīta

gāth'ābhigītaṃ me abhojaneyyaṃ,
sampassataṃ brāhmaṇa n'esa dhammo,
gāth'ābhigītaṃ panudanti buddhā,
dhamme satī brāhmaṇa vutti'r'esā.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

sattadhā me phale muddhā,
jīvanto na sukhaṃ labhe,
buddhagāth'ābhigīto'mhi,
no ce muñceyya candiman'ti.

SN 2.9 candimasuttaṃ
gādha 1

nt. (+loc) foothold (in); footing (in); ground for standing on (in) [√gādh + a] ✓

Grammar nt, from gādhati (+loc)
Meaning foothold (in); footing (in); ground for standing on (in)
Root Family √gādh
Root √gādh･1 a (stand firmly)
Construction √gādh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (SNa) gādhan'ti patiṭṭhaṃ
Sanskrit gādha
Sanskrit Root √gādh √gāh 1 (stand firmly)

n'atthi kiccaṃ brāhmaṇassa,
katakicco hi brāhmaṇo,
yāva na gādhaṃ labhati nadīsu,
āyūhati sabbagattebhi jantu,
gādhañ'ca laddhāna thale ṭhito yo,
n'āyūhatī pāragato hi so'va.

SN 2.5 dāmalisuttaṃ
gādha 2

adj. deep [√gādh] ✗
gādhati

pr. finds a footing; stands firmly; is well grounded; finds a support [√gādh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning finds a footing; stands firmly; is well grounded; finds a support
Root Family √gādh
Root √gādh･1 a (stand firmly)
Base √gādh + a > gādha
Construction gādha + ti
Commentary (SNa) gādhatī'ti na patiṭṭhāti.
Sanskrit gādhate
Sanskrit Root √gādh √gāh 1 (stand firmly)

kattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
kattha dīghañ'ca rassañ'ca,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
kattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhatī'ti.

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā ... rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā. ye suppaṭipannā, te imasmiṃ dhammavinaye gādhanti.

gādhi

aor. stood fast, had a firm footing [√gādh] ✗
gāma 1

paleti rasam'ādāya,
evaṃ gāme munī care.

yathā devo tathā duve,
yathā gāmo tathā tayo,
kolāhalaṃ tat'uttarin'ti.

Commentary (ANa) dve vā tīṇi vā māgadhakāni gāmakkhettānī'ti ettha māgadhikaṃ gāmakkhettaṃ atthi khuddakaṃ, atthi majjhimaṃ, atthi mahantaṃ. khuddakaṃ gāmakkhettaṃ ito cattālīsaṃ usabhāni, ito cattālīsan'ti gāvutaṃ hoti, majjhimaṃ ito gāvutaṃ, ito gāvutan'ti aḍḍhayojanaṃ hoti, mahantaṃ ito diyaḍḍhagāvutaṃ, ito diyaḍḍhagāvutan'ti tigāvutaṃ hoti. tesu khuddakena gāmakkhettena tīṇi, khuddakena ca majjhimena ca dve gāmakkhettāni tassa attabhāvo. tigāvutañ'hi'ssa sarīraṃ.

gāmakhetta

nt. village area; local district ✗
gāmagata 1

adj. gone to a village [gāma + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning gone to a village
Construction gāma + gata

Sanskrit grāma + gata

evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, goṇo kiṭṭh'ādo gāmagato vā araññagato vā, ṭhānabahulo vā assa nisajjabahulo vā na taṃ kiṭṭhaṃ puna otareyya, tam'eva purimaṃ daṇḍasamphassaṃ samanussaranto.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu gāmagato vā araññagato vā labhati vattāraṃ, ayañ'ca kho āyasmā evaṃkārī evaṃsamācāro asucigāmakaṇṭako'ti. taṃ kaṇṭako'ti iti viditvā saṃvaro ca asaṃvaro ca veditabbo.

Commentary (VIN 2.5.3.7) antamaso gām'antaram'pī'ti kukkuṭasampāte gāme (VINa) kukkuṭasampāde'ti ettha yasmā gāmā nikkhamitvā kukkuṭo padasāva aññaṃ gāmaṃ gacchati, ayaṃ kukkuṭasampādo'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit grāmāntara

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ek'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya antamaso gām'antaram'pi aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 27 saṃvidhānasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ek'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya antamaso gām'antaram'pi, pācittiyaṃ.

Sanskrit grāmānta + vihārin

yassa kassaci, āvuso, bhikkhuno ime pāpakā akusalā icch'āvacarā pahīnā dissanti c'eva sūyanti ca, kiñ'c'āpi so hoti gām'antavihārī nemantaniko gahapaticīvaradharo, atha kho naṃ sabrahmacārī sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti.

√ In Comps ggah
Base √gah + *āpe > gāhāpe (caus)
Construction gāhāpe + tvā
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit grah
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

sakko devarājā, kiṃ no sādhāraṇena rajjenā'ti asure dibbapānaṃ pāyetvā matte samāne pādesu gāhāpetvā sinerupabbatapāde khipāpesi. te asurabhavanam'eva sampāpuṇiṃsu.

JAa 31 kulāvaka jātakavaṇṇanā

tesu ariyasāvakānaṃ dve'y'eva kiccāni ahesuṃ. purebhattaṃ dānaṃ denti, pacchābhattaṃ gandhamāl'ādihatthā vatthabhesajjapānak'ādīni gāhāpetvā dhammassavan'atthāya gacchanti.

DHPa 1.1.1 cakkhupālattheravatthu
gāhitāgāhita

Meaning what has been confiscated and what has not been confiscated
Construction gāhita + agāhita

ayoge yuñjam'attānaṃ,
yogasmiñ'ca ayojayaṃ,
atthaṃ hitvā piyaggāhī,
pihet'att'ānuyoginaṃ.

gāḷha 1

adj. thick; dense; lit. immersed [√gāh + ta] ✓

Sanskrit gāḍha
Sanskrit Root √gāh 1 (plunge)

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ
gijjhakūṭa

masc. name of a mountain peak around Rājagaha; lit. vulture’s peak [gijjha + kūṭa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a mountain peak around Rājagaha; lit. vulture’s peak
Construction gijjha + kūṭa
Compound kammadhāraya (gijjha + kūṭa)
Commentary (ANa) gijjhakūṭe'ti gijjhā tassa kūṭesu vasiṃsu, gijjhasadisaṃ vā tassa kūṭaṃ atthī'ti gijjhakūṭo, tasmiṃ gijjhakūṭe.
Sanskrit gṛdhra + kūṭa

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahācundo āyasmā ca channo gijjhakūṭe pabbate viharanti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

divāvihārā nikkhamma,
gijjhakūṭamhi pabbate,
nāgaṃ ogāhamuttiṇṇaṃ,
nadītīramhi addasaṃ.

giñjakāvasathasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 14.13 (SN14.13) ✗

Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change dht > ddh
Antonym agiddha
Sanskrit gardhita, gṛdhnu
Sanskrit Root √gṛdh 4 (be greedy)

yo hi koci, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ lābhasakkārasilokaṃ assādeti nikāmeti, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu giddho papatāya anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ

kāmesu giddhā pasutā pamūḷhā,
avadāniyā te visame niviṭṭhā,
dukkh'ūpanītā paridevayanti,
kiṃ'sū bhavissāma ito cutāse.

gini

anutīre mahiyā samānavāso,
channā kuṭi āhito gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 2

akkodhano vigatakhilo'ham'asmi,
anutīre mahiy'ekarattivāso,
vivaṭā kuṭi nibbuto gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 2
gimha

masc. heat; warmth ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning heat; warmth
Synonym tāpa
Sanskrit grīṣma

vanappagumbe yatha phussit'agge,
gimhānamāse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe,
tath'ūpamaṃ dhammavaraṃ adesayi,
nibbānagāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya,
idam'pi buddhe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
gimhā

masc. hot season; summer; lit. hot months [gimha + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl of gimha
Meaning hot season; summer; lit. hot months
Construction gimha + ā
Sanskrit grīṣma

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ūhataṃ rajojallaṃ, tam'enaṃ mahāakālamegho ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ

māso seso gimhānan'ti, bhikkhunā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ, addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāsetabbaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 24 vassikasāṭikasikkhāpadaṃ
gimhāna

nt. hot season; summer; lit. of the hot [gimha + ā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from gimha
Meaning hot season; summer; lit. of the hot
Construction gimha + ā + ana
Derivative taddhita (ana)
Notes wrong derivation of gen pl of gimhā. gimhānaṃ > gimhāna
Sanskrit grīṣma

addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāsetabbanti. addhamāse sese gimhāne katvā nivāsetabbaṃ

masc. mountain-top festival [giragga + samajja] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mountain-top festival
Construction giragga + samajja
Commentary (VINa) gir'aggasamajjo'ti girimhi aggasamajjo, girissa vā aggadese samajjo. (PYt) imehi padehi aggo samajjo aggasamajjo, girimhi pavatto aggasamajjo gir'aggasamajjo'ti atthaṃ dasseti. samajjo'ti ca sabhā. sā hi samāgamaṃ ajanti gacchanti janā etthā'ti samajjo'ti vuccati. girissa vā'tiādinā girissa aggo koṭi gir'aggo, tasmiṃ pavatto samajjo gir'aggasamajjo'ti attho dassito.

giraṃ saccam'udīraye,
yāya n'ābhisaje kañci,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 408 brāhmaṇavaggo

sampajānamusāvādo nāma visaṃvādanapurekkhārassa vācā, girā, byappatho, vacībhedo, vācasikā viññatti, aṭṭha anariyavohārā, adiṭṭhaṃ diṭṭhaṃ me'ti, assutaṃ sutaṃ me'ti

anuddhato acapalo,
nipako saṃvut'indriyo,
sobhati paṃsukūlena,
sīho'va girigabbhare.

dijassa sutvā girigabbhare rutaṃ,

saṃcintaye taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

giriduggacara

giribbaja 1

nt. mountain cave; mountain cavern [giri + vaja] ✓

Meaning mountain cave; mountain cavern
Construction giri + vaja

Synonym girigabbhara
Sanskrit giri + vraja

kadā nu maṃ tandi khudā pipāsā,
vāt'ātapā kīṭasarīsapā vā,
na bādhayissanti na taṃ giribbaje,
atth'atthiyaṃ taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

nanu ahaṃ citta tay'āmhi yācito,
giribbaje citrachadā vihaṅgamā,
mahindaghosatthanit'ābhigajjino,
te taṃ ramessanti vanamhi jhāyinaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
giribbaja 2

nt. name of a former capital of Magadha ✗
girimānanda

masc. name of a monk; lit. happy mountain [giriṃ + ānanda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; lit. happy mountain
Construction giriṃ + ānanda
Commentary (THa) so tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde rājagahe bimbisārarañño purohitassa putto hutvā nibbatti, girimānando'ti'ssa nāmaṃ ahosi.
Sanskrit girim + ānanda

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā girimānando ābādhiko hoti dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
girimānandattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 200 (TH200) ✗
girimānandasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.60 (AN10.60) ✗
giriseṭṭha

masc. highest mountain; foremost peak [giri + seṭṭha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning highest mountain; foremost peak
Construction giri + seṭṭha
Compound kammadhāraya (giri + seṭṭha)
Sanskrit giri + śreṣṭha

vipulo rājagahīyānaṃ,
giriseṭṭho pavuccati,
seto himavataṃ seṭṭho,
ādicco aghagāminaṃ.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
gila

pp. swallowed, devoured, eaten [√gil] ✗
gilati

pr. (+acc) swallows; devours; eats [√gil + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning swallows; devours; eats
Root Family √gil
Root √gil･1 a (eat, swallow)
Base √gil + a > gila
Construction gila + ti
Sanskrit girati
Sanskrit Root √gṛ √gṝ √gir 6, 9 (swallow)

app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā uṭṭhaheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
gilanta

prp. swallowing, devouring [√gil] ✗
gilabaḷisa

gilāna 1

adj. sick; ill; unwell; lit. being sick [√gilā + ana] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning sick; ill; unwell; lit. being sick
Root Family √gilā
Root √gilā･3 ya (be sick, tired)
Construction √gilā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Antonym agilāna
Sanskrit glāna
Sanskrit Root √glai √glā 1, 2, 4 (be weary)

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhun'upassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ. tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānā hoti bhikkhunī, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 23 bhikkhunupassayasikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso ābādhiko assa dukkhito bāḷhagilāno

Sanskrit glānaka (bsk)

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yo so bhattu abbhantaro antojano, dāsā'ti vā pessā'ti vā kammakarā'ti vā, tesaṃ katañ'ca katato jānāti akatañ'ca akatato jānāti, gilānakānañ'ca bal'ābalaṃ jānāti khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyañ'c'assa paccaṃsena saṃvibhajati.

gilānapaccayabhesajja

nt. healthcare and medicine [gilānapaccaya + bhesajja] ~

Grammar nt, comp

Construction gilānapaccaya + bhesajja
gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra

masc. healthcare and medicinal requisites; support for the sick and medicines [gilānapaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning healthcare and medicinal requisites; support for the sick and medicines
Construction gilānapaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra
Compound dvanda (gilānapaccaya ca bhesajjaparikkhāra ca)
Variant gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāra
Commentary (VISM) gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāran'ti ettha rogassa paṭiayan'aṭṭhena paccayo, paccanīkagaman'aṭṭhenā'ti attho. yassa kassaci sappāyass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. bhisakkassa kammaṃ tena anuññātattā'ti bhesajjaṃ. gilānapaccayo'va bhesajjaṃ gilānapaccayabhesajjaṃ, yaṃkiñci gilānassa sappāyaṃ bhisakkakammaṃ telamadhuphāṇit'ādī'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit glānapratyaya + bheṣaja + pariṣkāra

paṭisaṅkhā yoniso gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva uppannānaṃ veyyābādhikānaṃ vedanānaṃ paṭighātāya abyāpajjha-paramatāyā

MN 2.4 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānuppadāna

nt. providing healthcare and medicinal requisites [gilānapaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra + anuppadāna] ~

Meaning providing healthcare and medicinal requisites
Construction gilānapaccaya + bhesajjaparikkhāra + anuppadāna
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāre + anuppadāna)
Sanskrit glānapratyaya + bheṣaja + pariṣkāra + anupradāna
gilānapucchaka

adj. who enquires about health of; lit. who enquires about sickness [gilāna + pucchaka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who enquires about health of; lit. who enquires about sickness
Construction gilāna + pucchaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gilānaṃ + pucchaka)
Sanskrit glāna + pṛcchaka

atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāy'anhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yen'āyasmā mahācundo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahācundaṃ etadavoca, āyām'āvuso cunda, yen'āyasmā channo ten'upasaṅkamissāma gilānapucchakā'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū gilānā honti. gilānapucchakā bhikkhū gilāne bhikkhū etadavocuṃ, kacc'āvuso, khamanīyaṃ, kacci yāpanīyan'ti?

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

āmisahetū'ti cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu sen'āsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu.

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu

āmisahetū'ti cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu sen'āsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu.

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ

na kho pan'āhaṃ cīvarahetu agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito na piṇḍapātahetu ... na sen'āsanahetu ... na gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito.

Sanskrit glāna + samaya

tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāv'ābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

paramparabhojane aññatra samayā pācittiyaṃ. tatth'āyaṃ samayo, gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

gilānātiritta

nt. leftovers of a sick person [gilāna + atiritta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning leftovers of a sick person
Construction gilāna + atiritta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gilānassa + atiritta)
Commentary (VINa) gilān'ātirittan'ti ettha na kevalaṃ yaṃ gilānassa bhutt'āvasesaṃ hoti, taṃ gilān'ātirittaṃ, atha kho yaṃkiñci gilānaṃ uddissa ajja vā sve vā yadā vā icchati, tadā khādissatī'ti āhaṭaṃ, taṃ sabbaṃ gilān'ātirittan'ti veditabbaṃ.
Sanskrit glāna + pṛcchaka

bhuttāvinā pavāritena āsanā vuṭṭhitena kataṃ hoti, alam'etaṃ sabban'ti avuttaṃ hoti, na gilān'ātirittaṃ hoti, etaṃ anatirittaṃ nāma.

AN 3.22 gilānasuttaṃ
gili

Sanskrit gīryāt
Sanskrit Root √gṛ √gṝ √gir 6, 9 (swallow)

jhāya bhikkhu mā pamādo,
mā te kāmaguṇe ramessu cittaṃ,
mā lohaguḷaṃ gilī pamatto,
mā kandi dukkham'idan'ti ḍayhamāno.

DHP 371 bhikkhuvaggo

yo andhakāre tamasi pabhaṅ'karo,
verocano maṇḍalī uggatejo.
mā rāhu gilī caram'antalikkhe,
pajaṃ mamaṃ rāhu pamuñca sūriyan'ti.

abs. having swallowed, having devoured [√gil] ✗

geha + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Phonetic Change a > i
Synonym gahaṭṭha
Sanskrit gṛhin
Sanskrit Root √grah √grabh 1, 9 (seize)

cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.

tesaṃ gihī pasann'ākāraṃ karonti. te taṃ lābhaṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhopannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.

ruṇṇam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ gītaṃ. ummattakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ naccaṃ. komārakam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yadidaṃ ativelaṃ dantavidaṃsakahasitaṃ.

AN 3.108 ruṇṇasuttaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, dakkhiṇesu janapadesu dhovanaṃ nāma. tattha hoti annam'pi pānam'pi khajjam'pi bhojjam'pi leyyam'pi peyyam'pi naccam'pi gītam'pi vāditam'pi. atth'etaṃ, bhikkhave, dhovanaṃ, n'etaṃ n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

gīvā 1

SN 56.48 dutiyachiggaḷayugasuttaṃ

so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ ajapadena daṇḍena suniggahitaṃ niggaṇheyya. ajapadena daṇḍena suniggahitaṃ niggahitvā, gīvāya suggahitaṃ gaṇheyya.

tuyhaṃ dhītā anopamā,
tato aṭṭhaguṇaṃ dassaṃ,
hiraññaṃ ratanāni ca.

THI 54 anopamātherīgāthā

ucc'āvacā hi paṭipadā,
samaṇena pakāsitā,
na pāraṃ diguṇaṃ yanti,
na'y'idaṃ ekaguṇaṃ mutaṃ.

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

atha kho so, bhikkhave, mudumūsi gocarāya pakkāmi. tam'enaṃ biḷāro gahetvā sahasā saṅkhāditvā ajjhohari. tassa so mudumūsi antam'pi khādi, antaguṇam'pi khādi.

BV 2 sumedhapatthanākathā

Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

yatthakāmanipātinaṃ,
cittaṃ rakkhetha medhāvī,
cittaṃ guttaṃ sukh'āvahaṃ.

DHP 36 cittavaggo

annañ'ca laddhā vasanañ'ca kāle,
mattaṃ so jaññā idha tosan'atthaṃ,
so tesu gutto yatacāri gāme,
rusito'pi vācaṃ pharusaṃ na vajjā.

AN 4.37 aparihāniyasuttaṃ

indriyesu guttadvārā bhavissāma, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā na nimittaggāhī n'ānubyañjanaggāhī

fem. (+gen) guarding (of); protecting (of); watching (over) [√gup + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from gopeti (+gen)
Meaning guarding (of); protecting (of); watching (over)
Root Family √gup
Root √gup･1 a (guard)
Construction √gup + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change p > t
Sanskrit gupti
Sanskrit Root √gup 1 (protect)

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattā āharati dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā taṃ ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, tattha ca hoti adhuttī athenī asoṇḍī avināsikā.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

tatr'āyam'ādi bhavati,
idha paññassa bhikkhuno,
indriyagutti santuṭṭhi,
pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro.

DHP 375 bhikkhuvaggo
guttijita

masc. name of a privately enlightened Buddha [gutti + jita] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha
Construction gutti + jita
guttindriya

adj. protecting the mind; guarding the sense faculties [gutta + indriya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning protecting the mind; guarding the sense faculties
Construction gutta + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (gutta + indriya)
Sanskrit gupta + indriya

adhisīlaṃ adhicittaṃ,
adhipaññañ'ca vīriyavā,
thāmavā dhitimā jhāyī,
sato guttindriyo care.

tassa na t'ādiso vaṇṇo hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na t'ādiso saro hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ, na t'ādisaṃ padaṃ hoti seyyathā'pi gunnaṃ.

AN 3.83 gadrabhasuttaṃ

so govataṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gosīlaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gocittaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gav'ākappaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā gunnaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.

Construction go + ānaṃ

gunnaṃ ce taramānānaṃ,
jimhaṃ gacchati puṅgavo,
sabbā tā jimhaṃ gacchanti,
nette jimhaṃ gate sati.

tāḷaṃ vā susamāhitaṃ,
anamhikāle sussoṇi,
kiṃ nu jagghasi sobhaṇe.

Sri Lanka buddha-vassa-sajjhāyanā
gulāguṇṭhikajāta

adj. like a tangled bird's nest; (comm) (or) like a sticky ball of thread [gulā + guṇṭhika + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a tangled bird's nest; (comm) (or) like a sticky ball of thread
Construction gulā + guṇṭhika + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (gulāguṇṭhika + jāta)
Variant kulāguṇṭhikajāta
Commentary (ANa) gulāguṇṭhikajāto'ti gulāguṇṭhikaṃ vuccati pesakārakañjiyasuttaṃ. gulā nāma sakuṇikā, tassā kulāvako'ti'pi eke.
Sanskrit kulāya + guṇṭhita + jāta

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

guhaṭṭhakasutta

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

satto guhāyaṃ bahun'ābhichanno,
tiṭṭhaṃ naro mohanasmiṃ pagāḷho,
dūre vivekā hi tathāvidho so,
kāmā hi loke na hi suppahāyā.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
guhāgehagata

adj. living in a cave dwelling; lit. gone to cave home [guhā + geha + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living in a cave dwelling; lit. gone to cave home
Construction guhā + geha + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (guhāgehaṃ + gata)
Commentary (THa) tahiṃ guhāgehagato ramissasī'ti tasmiṃ pabbatakānane guhāsaṅkhātaṃ gehaṃ upagato bhāvanāratiyā abhiramissasi.
Sanskrit guhā + geha + gata

varāhaeṇeyyavigāḷhasevite,
pabbhārakuṭṭe pakat'eva sundare,
nav'ambunā pāvusasitthakānane,
tahiṃ guhāgehagato ramissasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

Sanskrit guhāśaya

dūraṅ'gamaṃ ekacaraṃ,
asarīraṃ guh'āsayaṃ,
ye cittaṃ saṃyamessanti,
mokkhanti mārabandhanā.

DHP 37 cittavaggo

it'āyaṃ kodharūpena,
maccupāso guhāsayo,
taṃ damena samucchinde,
paññāvīriyena diṭṭhiyā.

DHP 308 nirayavaggo

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso garukaṃ silāguḷaṃ allamattikāpuñje pakkhipeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu taṃ garukaṃ silāguḷaṃ allamattikāpuñje labhetha otāran'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

pubb'āsave hitvā nave akubbaṃ,
na chandagū no'pi nivissavādī,
sa vippamutto diṭṭhigatehi dhīro,
na lippati loke anattagarahī.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
gūtha

Sanskrit Root √gu √gū 6 (void)

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, pathaviyā sucim'pi nikkhipanti, asucim'pi nikkhipanti, gūthagatam'pi nikkhipanti, muttagatam'pi nikkhipanti, kheḷagatam'pi nikkhipanti, pubbagatam'pi nikkhipanti, lohitagatam'pi nikkhipanti, na ca tena pathavī aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mīḷhakā gūth'ādī gūthapūrgūthassaā puṇṇā. purato c'assa mahāgūthapuñjo. sā tena aññā mīḷhakā atimaññeyya, aham'hi gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa, purato ca my'āyaṃ mahāgūthapuñjo'ti.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
gūthakaṭāha

masc. pot for defecation ✗

Meaning cesspit; long drop; lit. excrement pit

Compound kammadhāraya (gūtha + kūpa)

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sāriputta, gūthakūpo sādhikaporiso, pūro gūthassa. atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito ekāyanena maggena tam'eva gūthakūpaṃ paṇidhāya.

Construction gūtha + ādī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (gūthaṃ + ādī)
Commentary (SNa) gūth'ādī'ti gūthabhakkhā
Sanskrit gūtha + ādin

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mīḷhakā gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa. purato c'assa mahāgūthapuñjo. sā tena aññā mīḷhakā atimaññeyya, aham'hi gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa, purato ca my'āyaṃ mahāgūthapuñjo'ti.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
gūḷhaka

adj. hidden; secret ✗
geṇḍu 1

masc. playing ball ✗
geṇḍu 2

masc. tower; turret ✗
gedha 1.1

masc. (+loc) greed (for); desire (for); yearning (for) [√gidh + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from gijjhati (+loc)
Meaning greed (for); desire (for); yearning (for)
Root Family √gidh
Root √gidh･3 ya (be greedy)
Construction √gidh > gedh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit gṛddha
Sanskrit Root √gṛdh 4 (be greedy)

diṭṭhiñ'ca anupaggamma,
sīlavā dassanena sampanno,
kāmesu vineyya gedhaṃ,
na hi jātu gabbhaseyya punar'etī'ti.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

kāmesu vinaya gedhaṃ,
nekkhammaṃ daṭṭhu khemato,
uggahītaṃ nirattaṃ vā,
mā te vijjittha kiñcanaṃ.

sace kho tvaṃ, mārisa, evaṃ pajānāsi, sace tvaṃ evaṃ anubuddho, mā sāvake upanesi, mā pabbajite, mā sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desesi, mā pabbajitānaṃ, mā sāvakesu gedhim'akāsi, mā pabbajitesu.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

ahesuṃ kho, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ arahanto sammāsambuddhā paṭijānamānā. te sāvake upanesuṃ pabbajite, sāvakānaṃ dhammaṃ desesuṃ pabbajitānaṃ, sāvakesu gedhim'akaṃsu pabbajitesu

Sanskrit gokaṇṭaka + hata

sītā, bhante, hem'antikā ratti, antar'aṭṭhako himapātasamayo, kharā gokaṇṭakahatā bhūmi, tanuko paṇṇasantharo, viraḷāni rukkhassa pattāni, sītāni kāsāyāni vatthāni, sīto ca verambho vāto vāyati.

avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā, app'eva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṃ anujāneyya

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ

taṃ buddham'anantagocaraṃ,
apadaṃ kena padena nessatha.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
gocaramūlakaabhinīhārasuttādicatukka

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 34.46-49 (SN34.46-49) ✗
gocaravisaya 1

masc. feeding ground; lit. pasture and environment [gocara + visaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning feeding ground; lit. pasture and environment
Construction gocara + visaya
Compound dvanda (gocara ca visaya ca)
Sanskrit gocara + viśaya

daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā majjhe gaṇṭhiṃ karitvā ossajjeyya. atha kho, te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
gocaravisaya 2

masc. range and domain; sense range; sense field [gocara + visaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning range and domain; sense range; sense field
Construction gocara + visaya
Compound dvanda (gocara ca visaya ca)
Commentary (MNa) gocaravisayan'ti gocarabhūtaṃ visayaṃ.
Sanskrit gocara + viśaya

imesaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ nānāvisayānaṃ nānāgocarānaṃ na aññam'aññassa gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhontānaṃ mano paṭisaraṇaṃ, mano'va nesaṃ gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhotī'ti.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ

pañc'imāni, āvuso, indriyāni nānāvisayāni nānāgocarāni, na aññam'aññassa gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhonti, seyyath'idaṃ, cakkhu'ndriyaṃ, sot'indriyaṃ, ghān'indriyaṃ, jivh'indriyaṃ, kāy'indriyaṃ.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
gocariya

adj. muddy brown; tawny brown; lit. fodder-ish [go + cara + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from gocara
Meaning muddy brown; tawny brown; lit. fodder-ish
Construction go + cara + iya
gocara + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Commentary (VINa) gocariyānan'ti kapilavaṇṇānaṃ.
Sanskrit gocarika (bsk)

navaṃ pana bhikkhunā santhataṃ kārayamānena dve bhāgā suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ ādātabbā, tatiyaṃ odātānaṃ, catutthaṃ gocariyānaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 13 dvebhāgasikkhāpadaṃ

catutthaṃ gocariyānan'ti tulaṃ gocariyānaṃ.

VIN 1.4.2.3 dvebhāgasikkhāpadaṃ
gocitta

nt. mind of a cow; cow's mentality [go + citta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning mind of a cow; cow's mentality
Construction go + citta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (gāvassa + citta)
Sanskrit go + citta

so govataṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gosīlaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gocittaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ, gav'ākappaṃ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā gunnaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ
goṭṭha

nt. cow-pen; cattle-fold [go + ṭha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning cow-pen; cattle-fold
Construction go + ṭha
Compound kammadhāraya (go + ṭha)
Commentary (MNa) goṭṭhā'ti govajā.
Sanskrit gosthāna

so kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, ye te goṭṭhā paṭṭhitagāvo apagatagopālakā, tattha catukkuṇḍiko upasaṅkamitvā yāni tāni vacchakānaṃ taruṇakānaṃ dhenupakānaṃ gomayāni tāni sudaṃ āhāremi.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
goṇa

masc. ox; bull ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning ox; bull
Synonym balibadda, balībadda, balibaddha, balivadda, vahant
Sanskrit goṇa

katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso caṇḍaṃ hatthiṃ parivajjeti, caṇḍaṃ assaṃ parivajjeti, caṇḍaṃ goṇaṃ parivajjeti, caṇḍaṃ kukkuraṃ parivajjeti

MN 2.6 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

atha naṃ āha, amma, kāḷi imasmiṃ nagare pañca sakaṭasatāni paccūsakāle uṭṭhāya vāṇijjāya gacchanti, tvaṃ imaṃ netvā cakkamagge nipajjāpehi, goṇā vā naṃ maddissanti, cakkā vā chindissanti, pavattiṃ c'assa ñatvāva āgaccheyyāsī'ti.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu

Sanskrit goṇikā + tūlaka + saṃstṛta

sudhotarajapacchadaṃ subhaṃ,
goṇakatūlikasanthataṃ navaṃ,
abhiruha sayanaṃ mah'ārahaṃ,
candanamaṇḍitasāragandhikaṃ.
